connector.description: Send and receive messages from NSQ realtime distributed messaging platform.

camel.source.endpoint.servers.name: camel.source.endpoint.servers
camel.source.endpoint.servers.description: The hostnames of one or more nsqlookupd servers (consumer) or nsqd servers (producer)

camel.source.endpoint.userAgent.name: camel.source.endpoint.userAgent
camel.source.endpoint.userAgent.description: A String to identify the kind of client

camel.source.endpoint.autoFinish.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoFinish
camel.source.endpoint.autoFinish.description: Automatically finish the NSQ Message when it is retrieved from the queue and before the Exchange is processed

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.messageTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.messageTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.messageTimeout.description: The NSQ consumer timeout period for messages retrieved from the queue. A value of -1 is the server default

camel.source.endpoint.requeueInterval.name: camel.source.endpoint.requeueInterval
camel.source.endpoint.requeueInterval.description: The requeue interval in milliseconds. A value of -1 is the server default

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.secure.name: camel.source.endpoint.secure
camel.source.endpoint.secure.description: Set secure option indicating TLS is required

camel.component.nsq.servers.name: camel.component.nsq.servers
camel.component.nsq.servers.description: The hostnames of one or more nsqlookupd servers (consumer) or nsqd servers (producer).

camel.component.nsq.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.component.nsq.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.nsq.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.nsq.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.nsq.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.nsq.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.nsq.useGlobalSslContextP.name: camel.component.nsq.useGlobalSslContextParameters
camel.component.nsq.useGlobalSslContextP.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
